0.3.description:
Runs the Python or PowerShell script provided, using the specified runtime and handler. (For PowerShell, the handler is not required.)

Currently, the aws:executeScript action contains the following preinstalled PowerShell Core modules.

	Microsoft.PowerShell.Host

	Microsoft.PowerShell.Management

	Microsoft.PowerShell.Security

	Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility

	PackageManagement

	PowerShellGet

Runtime.description: The runtime language to be used for executing the provided script. Currently, aws:executeScript supports Python 3.6 (python3.6), Python 3.7 (python3.7), and PowerShell Core 6.0 (dotnetcore2.1) scripts.

Handler.description: The entry for script execution, usually a function name. You must ensure the function defined in the handler has two parameters, events and context. (Not required for PowerShell.)

InputPayload.description: A JSON or YAML object that will be passed to the first parameter of the handler. This can be used to pass input data to the script.

Script.description: An embedded script that you want to run during the automation execution. (Not supported for JSON documents.)

Attachment.description: The name of a standalone script file or .zip file that can be invoked by the action. To invoke a file for python, use the filename.method_name format in Handler. For PowerShell, invoke the attachment using and inline script. Gzip is not supported.
